goal: Build a production-ready MVP mobile app that fetches NBA player/game data and sportsbook lines, performs simple data manipulation (aggregations, rolling averages, deltas), and displays them in clear, interactive views (no machine learning).
targetPlatform: React Native app using Expo (iOS primary, Android secondary).

primaryUser.description: Sports bettor or NBA fan who wants a clean dashboard for tonight's slate and player stats.
primaryUser.coreNeed: Quickly see relevant stats and line comparisons without manual spreadsheet work.

nonGoals: No social features or slip sharing.
No multi-sport support in MVP (NBA only).

frontend.stateManagement: Zustand or Redux (developer choice, default to Zustand)
frontend.designStyle: Simple card-based UI, dark theme with green accents for 'edge' or good spots.

backend.auth: Simple email/password or anonymous auth for MVP (can integrate with Firebase later).

derivedMetrics.description: All 'insight' in the MVP is from simple data manipulation NOT ML.

frontendScreens.name: DashboardScreen
frontendScreens.purpose: Show tonight's NBA slate, list top players with key stats and line comparisons.
coreUIElements: Filter chips: points, rebounds, assists, PRA
Player cards: name, team, market, line, season avg, last 5 avg, simple 'edge' indicator (just numeric difference or %).

frontendScreens.name: PlayerDetailScreen
frontendScreens.purpose: Give a deeper view of a single player.
coreUIElements: Overview: season vs last 5/10 stats, current lines with diffs.
Game log table: last N games with points/rebounds/assists and minutes.

frontendScreens.name: SettingsScreen
frontendScreens.purpose: Basic settings such as theme, favorite markets, and mock login/subscription stub.

backendEndpoints.description: Return tonight's games and players with manipulated stats and any available lines.
Return player profile, season averages, game logs, and lines.

mvpAcceptanceCriteria: User can open the app and see a list of players for today's games.
User can tap a player to see a detail screen with game logs and simple derived averages.
User can see sportsbook lines and basic delta calculations vs player averages.
The app does not rely on any machine learning or training pipeline.
All data manipulation is simple, deterministic aggregation and arithmetic, done either in backend or in-app.
